title: Banks versus markets: The scramble for India's retail investor
description: India's largest lender, SBI, hopes a stock market correction will drive depositors back to banks. As retail investors seek higher returns in equities, deposit growth lags credit growth, forcing banks to raise rates. The Reserve Bank of India is concerned about the widening credit-deposit gap, which poses systemic risks.
